revised_title: Dissection of a Human Foetus with Circulation of Blood without a Heart
tldr: The author describes the dissection of a human foetus that had circulation of blood without a heart. The foetus had a unique circulatory system, with the placenta acting as the source and termination of the circulation. The case highlights the importance of the placenta in fetal development and the unusual circumstances under which the blood can circulate without a heart.
